text:
Here are some tips that may help:
1. Prioritize your tasks and create a to-do list for each day. 
2. Set goals with specific deadlines to keep yourself accountable. 
3. Limit distractions by turning off notifications or finding a quiet place to work. 
4. Use time tracking apps to monitor how you're spending your time. 
5. Take breaks when needed, but make sure they don't interfere too much with the task at hand. 
6. Don't forget to set aside time for self-care and relaxation.

Stress is a natural response of your body to challenging or threatening situations.  There are many approaches that can help you manage and reduce stress, including:
1) Physical activity - this helps your heart pump more blood throughout your whole body which will make you feel less tense.
2) Talking about your problems can help get them off your chest as well as getting advice from others who may have experienced similar situations themselves.
3) Relaxation techniques such as meditation, deep breathing exercises and yoga can also be helpful for managing stress.
4) Avoiding caffeine and alcohol in excess are important because these stimulants tend to exacerbate the symptoms of anxiety and stress.
5) Eating healthily is essential as foods high in sugar and fat can give us an energy crash later on leaving us feeling irritable and anxious.  Foods like dark leafy greens, berries and lean protein sources contain key nutrients required for our mental health.
